Front: 🛠 How do you form futuro simple?
Back:
Infinitive + endings:
– yo -é
– tú -ás
– él/ella/usted -á
– nosotros/as -emos
– vosotros/as -éis
– ellos/ellas/ustedes -án
Example: hablar → hablaré

Front: 🛠 How do you form ir + a + infinitivo?
Back:
Present of ir + a + verb
Example: voy a comer (I’m going to eat)

Front: ❓ When do you use futuro simple?
Back:
👉 To talk about what will happen in the future
👉 For formal predictions
👉 For assumptions about the present
Example: Llegarán mañana. (They will arrive tomorrow.)

Front: ❓ When do you use ir + a + infinitivo?
Back:
👉 To talk about plans, intentions, decisions already made
👉 Often for the near future
Example: Voy a estudiar esta noche. (I’m going to study tonight.)

Front: 💡 Memory hook: How to remember the difference?
Back:
Futuro simple = formal, distant 🌌
Ir + a = near, planned 🚶
